attributes.description: This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-002088, focusing on monitoring security assessment events. This visualization displays the health status of security assessment event monitoring based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.name: <your_component_name>' or 'vulnerability.scanner.vendor: <vendor_name>' to focus on a specific system or scanner. Observe the trends and individual anomaly events. A high anomaly score indicates a significant deviation from the established baseline, which could signify unusual or unauthorized security assessment activity, misconfigurations, or a lack of expected assessment events.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-002088] Security Assessment Events Monitoring ML

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This table offers granular, verifiable proof that security assessments are being conducted.
This level of detail is essential for any audit, allowing you to pinpoint the exact time, target, and type of assessment.
Use it to investigate anomalies from the trend chart or to gather evidence for a specific component.

**How:** This is your primary source for detailed compliance verification.
Sort by '@timestamp' to confirm the recency of scans for a component.
Filter by `host.name` to isolate the evidence for the system you are assessing.
The `vulnerability.scanner.vendor` field can be used to confirm that approved scanning tools are being used.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON: {"query":{"query":"(event.category:vulnerability OR event.module:(nessus OR qualys OR tenable OR lynis OR openscap OR trivy) OR vulnerability.scanner.vendor:* OR file.name:(lynis-report-* OR nessus_report* OR qualys_scan* OR openscap-report* OR trivy-report*))","language":"kuery"},"filter":[],"indexRefName":"kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON.index"}

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-002088] Detailed Security Assessment Events

attributes.description:
This lists all of the unique host names that have had scans done on them.
This can be cross-referenced with other visualizations showing filtered lists of hosts.
In this situation the analyst should assess if the number is more or less than what the total hosts number count.
Some hosts will never be scanned and so it is expected this list to be less than the other

Other visualizations on this dashboard can be used to assess which hosts have not been scanned

query.query: (event.category:vulnerability OR event.module:(nessus OR qualys OR tenable OR lynis OR openscap OR trivy) OR vulnerability.scanner.vendor:* OR file.name:(lynis-report-* OR nessus_report* OR qualys_scan* OR openscap-report* OR trivy-report*))

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-002088] Total Scanned Hosts

attributes.description:
This lists all of the unique host names found in our logs.
This can be cross-referenced with other visualizations showing filtered lists of hosts
attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-002088] Total Hosts

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This chart provides a clear view of assessment coverage, helping you quickly verify if critical components are being scanned as part of the continuous monitoring program.
It's a useful tool to spot imbalances and identify any systems that might be over- or under-represented in scan activity.

**How:** Review the chart to ensure that your critical hosts are present.
If a component you are assessing is missing from this list, it may not be configured for scanning correctly.
Use the global filters to narrow the focus to a specific set of hosts to verify their individual scan status.

query.query: (event.category:vulnerability OR event.module:(nessus OR qualys OR tenable OR lynis OR openscap OR trivy) OR vulnerability.scanner.vendor:* OR file.name:(lynis-report-* OR nessus_report* OR qualys_scan* OR openscap-report* OR trivy-report*))

attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-002088] Assessment Coverage by Host
